sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Israel was keen to show its ground forces in Gaza on Saturday after a series of nighttime hit-and-run raids by its tanks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It says tanks and armored cars are now in the strip, but has stopped short of saying this is the full invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Overnight strikes knocked out telecommunications across Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Israel's air force has been targeting Hamas tunnels and bunkers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It claims to have killed Atsam Abu Rafa, described by Israel as head of the Hamas Air Force.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They say he'd been directing drones and paragliders against Israeli forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Israel says 1,400 people were killed in the Hamas attack on Oct. 7.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Gaza, the Hamas-run health ministry says the death toll among Palestinians has surpassed 7,700, claiming 60 percent are women and children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A sea of people flood the streets of central London, waving Palestinian flags and calling for an end to the conflict in Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Palestinian Health Ministry says more than 7,700 civilians have been killed in the three weeks since Hamas attacked Israel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Paris, protesters defied a government ban on pro-Palestinian demonstrations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: French authorities have cited security concerns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Activists say the ban violates the right to freedom of expression.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Demonstrators have also taken to the streets of Rome in a show of support for Palestinians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They called for peace and denounced Israel's bombardment of the Gaza Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The UN is calling for a humanitarian truce.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Standing up for the soldiers defending their country,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: peaceful protesters calling for Ukraine to demobilize or at least offer rest and recreation for those who've been on the front lines for 18 months. Victoria's father's in hospital, wounded, her husband's also in the army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They are all tired, both psychologically and physically. They can't stand there from the The physical toll being taken by Ukraine's soldiers is evident near Avdiivka in eastern Ukraine, where they've been holding off wave after wave of Russian assaults.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: While their soldiers battle it out diplomats from Russia and Ukraine sit at the UN in New York when there's concern exports of weapons to Ukraine and to Russia of fueling conflict Iranian state-run

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: media's reported the death of Armita Garavan, a teenager mysteriously injured on October 1st on a Tehran metro train she'd entered without wearing a headscarf.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: CCTV from the metro didn't show what happened on the train, but does show her friends carrying Armita's limp body off the carriage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: She'd been in a coma since the incident, with many speculating she'd been assaulted by religious police for flouting the rule demanding women and girls wear headscarves. in a coma since the incident, with many speculating she'd been assaulted by religious police for flouting the rule demanding women and girls wear headscarves. The official version is she suffered a sudden drop in blood pressure and fainted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Twenty-one miners have been killed and 23 remain trapped underground after a fire at a pit in Kazakhstan. The mine is owned by Luxembourg-listed global steel giant ArcelorMittal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's the worst accident at a Kazakhstan mine since 2006, when 41 miners died at the ArcelorMittal site.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: After the latest accident, Kazakh President Kasim Dzhomar Tukhayev announced the government would take control of the local subsidiary of the global steel giant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hurricane Otis left a trail of destruction in the Mexican resort city of Acapulco.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Category 5 storm hit the coast on Wednesday, killing at least 27 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Several have been reported missing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Much of the city is still without power, drinking water, fuel and communications. Roads and air travel have been cut. Government aid is yet to arrive. Troops have been sent to the city, but they're waiting for equipment to arrive to begin the cleanup. Mexico's president has described the aftermath as disastrous.
